column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Ensure Success With Options Calendar Spread
#Text=Trading calendar spreads successfully is quite simple to do and can increase your earnings .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Make sure you have software to plot your risk graph .
#Text=When trading straight calls or puts or vertical spreads ( all legs on the same month ) , it is relatively easy to work out the max risk , max profit and break even point to draw risk graph .
#Text=However , calendar is a horizontal spread that makes up of two different option months .
#Text=That makes it almost impossible to manually and accurately plot your risk graph .
#Text=So , you need software to do this .
#Text=Utilize your free broker tools or sign up for a paid program .
#Text=It does far more than just plotting risk graph such as modeling the implied volatility of the stock .
#Text=This analyzes if you should trade this stock or not .
#Text=20 % of the last year low in IV is the best .
#Text=Your break even points range is at least 10 % of stock price .
#Text=This spread trades on stocks that move between an obvious support & resistance .
#Text=It is recommended that you structure your risk graph so that your 2 break even points cover the range of stock â€™s movement .
#Text=The best distance between these two points is 10 % of stock price .
#Text=For example , if stock prices at $ 30 , your upside point should be $ 31.5 and downside point is $ 28.5 .
#Text=The wider , the merrier .
#Text=It will increase your chance of winning .
#Text=Also , when trading calendar you would want your stock to move less .
#Text=Statistics say that stocks under $ 50 move a lot less than those above $ 50 .
#Text=Max Profit to Max Risk ratio is at least 100 % .
#Text=Max Profit in this spread is the pointy head in the risk graph and your max risk is what you invest in the trade .
#Text=This is a very low risk trade so u would want at least 100 % potential profit to make your time and commission worth it .
#Text=120 % or more in potential profit is the best .
#Text=Probability of Winning is at least 60 % .
#Text=Different traders will have different number to identify their worth-the-time trades .
#Text=This author 's probability for calendar is 60 % to make it worth trading .
#Text=The higher is the better .
#Text=80 % is the best .
#Text=Avoid trading through earnings date .
#Text=Earning potentially causes the stock to jump in either direction and out of your trading range .
#Text=If you do nâ€™t really care or think this is a minor problem , do a research on the stock and see if it has historical record of jumping on earning .
#Text=Avoid trading through a dividends date .
#Text=This author traded once thru dividend date .
#Text=The risk graph completely crushed and collapsed .
#Text=The author lost a bit more than 50 % of the trade before he/she was taken out by the pre-plan exit order .
#Text=Pre-set your exits at the two break even points .
#Text=Pre-planning your exits , as you know , is the most important part of your trading .
#Text=For calendar spreads , you have 4 exit targets : 100 % profit , 50 % loss , upside break even and downside break even .
#Text=You can do this easily by setting up an OCO order that contains 4 orders that aim at those 4 targets above .
#Text=100 % profit and 50 % use limit order .
#Text=The other two utilize market order .
#Text=Trade with Puts .
#Text=Generally , you should trade put calendar .
#Text=This is because most of the time it is cheaper than calls .
#Text=Also , in case of an exercise , a call option will force you to short stock .
#Text=This can be harmful if the stock pay dividends on the day you get exercise , you will have to pay dividend to the owner of the share you short .
#Text=Trade Back-To-Back Spreads .
#Text=Back-To-Back means selling a nearest month option and buying the month right after that .
#Text=When trading this spread , you would expect the stock not to move .
#Text=And if it does , you would hurt so much .
#Text=The way to do this is make it gamma neutral or as close to zero as possible .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Larry Williams says not to invest more than 30 % of your portfolio in options so that you will always have cash .
#Text=If you have $ 10,000 and you invest 30 % and lose it , you will have $ 7,000 .
#Text=If you then have $ 7,000 do n't invest more than 30 % which is $ 2,100 .
#Text=If you lose the $ 2,100 , and you have $ 4,900 , do n't invest more than 30 % which is $ 1,470 .
#Text=I had a friend that lost 6 trades in a row and lost all his money because he did not follow this rule .
#Text=Options involve risk and no guarantee that you will make money at all in options trading .
